page.title: 18Media
page.content: There is an office of the Eastern Counties Newspapers Group Ltd in the High Street. The Dereham and Fakenham Times is published on Friday every week, price 15p. About 1O,OOO copies are printed, covering local news, views and events. The Talking Newspaper for the Blind is compiled by Adrian Hall of the Baptist Church. 30 people from Dereham and Fakenham gather and record news. Four readers record on two sides of a tape which runs for 1 hour. 112 copies are delivered free by the Post Office to blind people in the area. "Magnet" is a monthly magazine for the blind by pupils of Neatherd High School. l63 copies are circulated. The Norfolk Advertiser which is delivered free to every house has adverts and news of local events.
